I joined @HempRoundtable to talk about my bipartisan bill to legalize CBD in dietary supplements. A legal pathway ensures that these supplements are safe and the highest quality for consumers. It’s time for regulatory certainty for hemp-derived CBD products. https://t.co/Abi6IdXnUg

Thank you @The_NAVC for having me as a guest on your podcast today to talk about my bipartisan One Health Act to help prevent zoonotic diseases from turning in to pandemics like we are seeing with #COVID19. Veterinarians play a key role in helping to keep all of us safe! https://t.co/ZliwxdqZCK

Servicers will reach out to borrowers individually in August to let you know that your payments will begin again after September 30th.
No borrower will have to do anything additional to get these benefits for their federal student loans. These will be automatically instituted by your federal loan servicers.

The 0 percent interest rate is for the following types of federal student loans owned by ED:  -Defaulted and non-defaulted Direct Loans  -Defaulted and non-defaulted FFEL Program loans  -Federal Perkins Loans  -Non-federal owned FFEL or Perkins loans are not eligible
All suspended payments will still count if you are making efforts towards Public Service Loan Forgiveness or IDR forgiveness

Payments will automatically be stopped by loan servicers from March 13 – September 30  -Servicers will be issuing refunds for payments made between March 13th and April 10th when this will go into effect for most loan servicers
Payment suspensions and the 0 percent interest will be available for federally-owned loans  -Private loans and Non-federal FFEL and Perkins loans are not eligible under the CARES Act
